Asked whether he planned to stay another four years at Google to collect stock awards worth$ 100 million, Eric Schmidt said: Yes, that is my plan. Google said last month co-founder Larry Page would take over as chief executive from April 4 while Eric Schmidt would assume the role of executive chairman. chief executive in a surprising management reshuffling announced with the Internet company's fourth-quarter earnings, which jumped 29%. The Mountain View, Calif., company said the moves, effective April 4, were made to streamline decision-making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. Eric Schmidt will no longer be responsible for the day-to-day operations. Instead, he will become exective chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. Shortly before the service, surrounded by her husband Mark Kelly, Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi and her close friends Nancy Pelosi Debbie Wasserman Schultz ( D-Fla.) and Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand ( D-N.Y.), she opened her eyes. She's in her hospital bed. I'm holding her hand, we're talking about how great she is and how inspiring she is. And we're talking about all the fun things we want to do. And she's squeezing my hand and I'm knowing that she's reacting. She's moving her leg and she's moving her arms. And we're getting so excited because we can see that she's really trying so hard to communicate with us. He is definitely the guy to watch, says Bryan Fischer of the American Family Association, a group that opposes gay marriage and abortion. , Sergey Brin and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making," Eric Schmidt said in a posting on the company's official blog.
